comment: Gives a sample test a week before each test is due. If you know the practice tests, then you'll do great on the tests. Gives a quiz everyday in class, but its for a small percentage. Homework after every lecture that is due online. Do the homework, and study the practice tests hard and you'll pass the class easily. Responds to emails quickly.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS--Clear grading criteria

comment: He goes mostly by the book and gives examples from the book. If you memorize how the practice questions work in the same order you will be OK. DO THE HOMEWORK on Webassign its 10% of your grade. A Quiz every day but he usually does an example right before the quiz.  If you ask a question  the class answers.

Even though he seems like he knows the material and seems to be teaching us, his teaching is not similar to everyone else. he doesn't wait to make sure everyone got the material he just continues to move. His thick accent makes it hard to understand him unless you are sitting in the front and listening intensely
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: His accent his heavy but it mainly sounds like a mumbler. The homework he gives is over webassign so you can buy the book with webassign but it's not mandatory. The hw is where you learn most the material. He walks into class with pieces of paper that he reads off  and copies it to the board; people ask him questions but he hardly answers them.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: Heavy accent and boring, albeit by-the-book, explanations. The only reason to show up in class is to do the mandatory quizzes he hands out at the end of each lecture. Otherwise, you could easily follow the textbook according to the syllabus and still get at least a passing grade. At least he knows what he is teaching though.
